metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20154 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In lock_sock_nested of sock.c, there is a possible use after free due to arace condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-174846563References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-173.182
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-173.182
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-173.182
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-173.182
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-173.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-173.182').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-105.119~18.04.1').
